result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos A. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Case called at 8:34am [mo]
Defendant Carlos A. Garcia in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Garcia

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release and Huber privileges, to commence on 9/11/16 9:00AM

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment,or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay statutory costs

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court determines that DNA is already of file for Mr. Garcia
Felony Firearm and Voting Prohibition Warnings given

recess: 9:10am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 2:39pm [mo]
Defendant Carlos A. Garcia in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Garcia. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

The Defendant verifies date of birth and address 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--No Contact with the co-actor Mikeal Doyal
--No presence at Symbol Mattress in Watertown
--no acts or threats of violence
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess: 2:48pm
